result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Danley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-02-15 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Danley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Danley in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-02-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Jonathan Danley in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Danley in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant advised the Court that attorney Wendy Patrickus is representing him in on a case in Waukesha and will be representing him on this matter.  Court grants attorney Dick's motion to withdraw as counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Danley in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Danley in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  
Defendant Jonathan Danley in custody.  
Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
